by inertia (= the physical force that keeps something in the same position or moving in the same direction): The machine's centre of mass is inertially fixed. The team were attempting to focus power onto an inertially confined target.
More examplesFewer examplesThe increased pressure inertially confines the plasma and increases its density.The two isolated bodies now constitute a single system whose common centre of gravity moves inertially.The changes were inertially triggered, and did not result from emissions of carbon dioxide.
